metadata.title: CVE-2020-16012 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Side-channel information leakage in graphics in Google Chrome prior to87.0.4280.66 allowed a remote attacker to leak cross-origin data via acrafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-16012` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 83.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.3
firefox-geckodriver - 83.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.3
firefox-mozsymbols - 83.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.3
No subscription required

chromium-browser - 87.0.4280.66-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 87.0.4280.66-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 87.0.4280.66-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 87.0.4280.66-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 87.0.4280.66-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '83.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.3').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '87.0.4280.66-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
